name: Microbiology Chapter 5 Quiz
description: Quiz questions for Chapter 5 of Microbiology covering the eukaryotes of microbiology (protists, fungi, algae, helminths).
subject: Microbiology

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Paramecium spp. have hair-like appendages called ____________ for locomotion.
questions.explanation: Paramecium use cilia for locomotion.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Who are the closest relatives to Amoebozoas?
questions.explanation: Opisthokonta (which includes animals and fungi) are considered the closest relatives to Amoebozoa.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which protist is a concern because of its ability to contaminate water supplies and cause diarrheal illness?
questions.explanation: Giardia lamblia is a common cause of waterborne diarrheal disease.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Lichens attach to a surface using which structure?
questions.explanation: Lichens use rhizines, which are fungal hyphae, to anchor themselves to surfaces.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Phylum__________________ (the roundworms) is a diverse group containing more than 15,000 species, of which several are important human parasites
questions.explanation: Phylum Nematoda comprises the roundworms.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: When a population of _________________ becomes particularly dense, a red tide (a type of harmful algal bloom) can occur.
questions.explanation: Red tides are often caused by blooms of dinoflagellates.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is a distinguishing feature of apicomplexans?
options: may be photosynthetic or heterotrophic and have flagella
have cell walls with substantial cellulose
questions.explanation: Apicomplexans are characterized by being intracellular parasites with an apical complex of organelles used for host cell penetration.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: The life cycle of Schistosoma spp. includes several species of water snails, which serve as secondary hosts. The parasite is transmitted to humans through contact with contaminated water and takes up residence in the _____________ of the ______________ system.
questions.explanation: Schistosoma species reside in the veins of the digestive system (specifically mesenteric veins for some species).

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Most multicellular fungal bodies, commonly called molds, are made up of filaments called _____________ .
questions.explanation: The filamentous structures that make up molds are called hyphae.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: _______________ is a protozoal mechanism of asexual reproduction whereby the nucleus of a cell divides repeatedly before the cytoplasm of the cell divides.
questions.explanation: Schizogony is a form of asexual reproduction in some protozoa involving multiple nuclear divisions followed by cytoplasmic division.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Fungal cell walls contain___________ , as opposed to the cellulose found in the cell walls of plants and many protists.
questions.explanation: Fungal cell walls are primarily composed of chitin.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: The types of algae are mainly grouped according to which of the following?
questions.explanation: Algae are primarily classified based on their photosynthetic pigment types.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: ______________ are unicellular fungi that are _______________intracellular parasites.
questions.explanation: Microsporidia are unicellular fungi that are obligate intracellular parasites.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Some algae, the seaweeds, are macroscopic and may be confused with _________________ .
questions.explanation: Macroscopic algae, like seaweeds, are often confused with plants due to their appearance and photosynthetic nature.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: The protozoal disease malaria was responsible for 584,000 deaths worldwide (primarily children in Africa) in 2013, according to the World Health Organization.  Malaria is a ___________________ microbe.
questions.explanation: Malaria is caused by Plasmodium species, which are eukaryotic protists.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: A fluke is classified within which of the following?
questions.explanation: Flukes (trematodes) are a class within the phylum Platyhelminthes (flatworms).

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: A _______________ is a combination of two organisms, a green alga or cyanobacterium and fungus, living in a symbiotic relationship
questions.explanation: A lichen is a composite organism arising from a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and an alga or cyanobacterium.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Mushrooms are a type of which of the following?
questions.explanation: Mushrooms are the fleshy, spore-bearing fruiting bodies (basidiocarps) of certain fungi, typically Basidiomycota.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: A nonsegmented worm is found during a routine colonoscopy of an individual who reported having abdominal cramps, nausea, and vomiting. This worm is likely which of the following?
questions.explanation: Nematodes (roundworms) are nonsegmented worms. Annelids are segmented. Trematodes (flukes) are flatworms.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: The source of agar, which is typically used in the microbiology laboratory, is which of the following?
questions.explanation: Agar is a gelatinous substance derived from red algae.
